column1: ##Nazarene stuff, yay! Lets migrate this to AtE Proper's files eventually.##

column2: Nazarene

In the face of the conquests of Elton the Lawgiver, the Churches of the Nazarenes put aside the ancient doctrinal divides for the sake of their own survival. Adherents to this creed practice their own traditional forms of Christianity unmolested by their peers, and take part in the labyrinthine codes and civil systems of Californian society. The de facto spiritual leader of the Nazarenes is the Abbot of Saint Herman's Monastery, who both settles disputes between the Christian branches and protects the holy places of the pilgrims and the libraries of the archivists.
Nazarene rulers may gain sympathy with Cetic by decision.
True Cross

True Cross began as a isolationist strain of thought within California Christendom. Many church leaders bitterly resented the influence of the Eltonites and the seemingly lukewarm attitudes of their Christian brethren towards the influence of the Emperor. This smoldered into a pseudo-iconoclastic uprising which was quickly crushed by both mainline Christian and Imperial forces, driving the last of the zealots into the bandit-ridden mountains and isolated communities of the Sierra Nevada. They identify each other by the wearing of California Poppies and dream of the day when all of the Golden West may be under the shadow of the True Cross.
Saint Herman's Brotherhood
Brotherhood
The Fraternity of the True Cross
Fraternal
Defender of the Faith
Abbot
Abbess
Change Nazarene Sect
You have a once in a lifetime opportunity to change the way of your worship.
You permanently change your Nazarene Sect.
The time has come for you to choose what tradition of Christ you will dedicate yourself to. This is a once in a lifetime chance...
I will dedicate myself to the way of the Seraphs.
I will join the ranks of the Acolytes.
I will spread the good word of the Presbyters.
Acolyte

Acolytes are the adherents of the old Roman Rite. They take great pride in the fact that their church is the oldest in the Golden West, tracing their heritage back to Saint Junípero Serra and the Spanish Missions.
Seraph

Seraphs draw mostly from the ancient Eastern traditions and liturgy, and particularly from the writings of Hieromonk Seraphim Rose, a San Francisco native believed to have been born in the century before the deluge.
Presbyter

Presbyters are the descendants of the mighty Protestant church bodies and put more stock in personal faith then sacerdotal liturgy. They prefer a flatter church hierarchy and believe that secular rulers should be appointed at the whim of the community's revered elders
Ecstatic
This character believes in revelation and mystic interpretations of Holy Texts.
Flagellant
This character believes in asceticism, mortification of the flesh, and isolating oneself from the pleasures of the world.
Sword Saints
This character is to fall on their swords for the sake of the Lord. They value moral and muscular courage in the face of persecution and war.
Apostle
Apostle
Father
Mother
Elder
Elder
Brother
Sister
Shepherd
Shepherd
Caesar
Go on Pilgrimage
Able-bodied Nazarenes are expected to travel to the major Christian site in California corresponding to their religious affiliation once in their lives, to demonstrate their devotion to the Lord.
You select a destination for your journey based on your affiliation within the Church.
As a Seraph, it is only right that you visit the ancient monestary founded by Hieromonk Seraphim Rose outside Redding. Your bags are packed and you are ready to depart.
To Redding!
As an Acolyte, it is only right that you visit the ancient Christian mission located in San Diego. Your bags are packed and you are ready to depart.
To San Francisco!
As a Presbyter, it is only right that you visit the ancient Angelus Temple in the heart of Los Angeles. Your bags are packed and you are ready to depart.
To Los Angeles!
How dare you indulge in vice while on a holy pilgrimage? Get those cards out of my sight!
As your journey continues, you begin to ponder the deeper aspects of Christian theology. Night has fallen, but there is much to think about...

You have gotten lost near a fork in the road. As you look for landmarks, you see a mysterious man clad in white beckoning you. As approach, she points down the right path of the fork before disappearing. What could this mean?
This is a sign from God! To the right!
I don't trust him. To the left.
As you travel, a worker flags down your carriage. He explains that the road ahead is being repaired, and that no traffic will be allowed through until tomorrow.
Excuse me? I am a [Root.GetTitle]! Out of my way!
I will wait, just like everyone else.
You seem to have picked up an illness during your travels. You hope it is nothing serious...
This is intolerable!
As you rest outside of your carriage, you notice some bushes moving nearby. A large mountain lion emerges from between them. It seems to be growling at you...
I should back away slowly...
I will stand up straight and yell forcefully!
The mountain lion is undeterred by your efforts and lunges at you. You manage to escape, although not without suffering an injury.
Cougars are no joke.
The mountain lion responds to your efforts by returning to the bushes. You escape without so much as a scratch.
I should stay in the carriage from now on...

As you approach your destination, you look to the west and see a magnificent sunset over the mighty waters of the Pacific. It is somehow more beautiful than any sunset you have ever seen before in your life. This alone has made your pilgrimage worth it.
Marvelous.

You encounter a mendicant preacher with a moderately large audience. You decide to sit down and join them. As he speaks, you are struck by the conviction and simplicity of his speech. This preacher is truly a man of God...
Praise the Lord!

You have come across a small church that has been ignored by most of your fellow pilgrims. As you sit and pray, you realize that you live a sinful life. Now is as good a time as any to change your ways...
I must repent!
Redding

You have arrived in Redding, home to the Saint Herman Monestary. This humble monestary, founded before the Event by the renowned Hieromonk Seraphim Rose, has continued to spread its teachings despite every single catastrophe that has befallen this land, from the Event itself to the Gaian rebellions. The monks welcome you inside, eager to share their wisdom with a distinguished guest such as yourself.
Tell me about the life of Seraphim Rose.
San Diego

You have arrived at the San Diego Mission. Founded by Franciscan monks in ancient times to spread Christianity throughout California, the mission is known today as being home to the burial sight of California's first Christian martyr. After the Event, as Christianity began to wane in these lands, this mission became incredibly popular among Christian pilgrims.
I will pray at the martyr's tomb.
Los Angeles

You have arrived in Los Angeles, the City of Angels. Los Angeles is home to a grand pre-Event Christian Church known as the Angelus Temple. This temple, built by an ordinary worshiper after witnessing a vision from God, is one of the oldest surviving Christian houses of worship in the entire city. It stands as a marvel of ancient architecture  even the most skilled builders today could scarcely dream of replicating it.
Praise Jesus!
Redding is a true crossroads of faith, home to a Christian monestary and the sacred redwoods of the Gaians. Perhaps these two traditions have something in common...
We are both bear witness to the glory of God's creation.
No, we are not similar.
I know that we are all children of God.
San Diego is home to many Abrahamic religions besides Christianity. The divergent teachings of the south, the followers of the Islamic Prophet, and the Latter Day Saints all have a presence here.
We are all Christians, aren't we?
Muhammad was a wise man and a great leader.
Mormons are truly kindhearted and gentle people.
Los Angeles is a melting pot of faiths, home to many incredibly divergent religious traditions. Perhaps these traditions are not all that different from each other...
The Old World should be preserved and restored.
You have returned from your pilgrimage. You saw many things both during your journey and after your arrival, and you have learned many new things as a result.
I am glad that I went!
Study Holy Texts
All able Nazarenes are expected to gain a deep understanding of ancient Christian holy texts so that they may become familiar with Christian theology and less susceptible to apostasy.
Study Cetic Texts

All able Nazarenes are expected to gain a deep understanding of ancient Christian holy texts, however the Cetic Philosphy holds some christian influences with the Doves, perhaps it might be wise to study them as well?
You select a holy text to read based on your affiliation with the Church.
You have decided to delve deep into the teachings of one of the Church's holy fathers. Whose teachings will you choose to immerse yourself in?
Who else but Hieromonk Seraphim Rose?
You dedicate yourself to studying Seraphim Rose's texts and teachings.
I will choose Saint Gregory Palamas.
You dedicate yourself to studying Gregory Palamas's texts and teachings.
I will choose the foundational teachings of Thomas Aquinas.
You dedicate yourself to studying Thomas Aquinas's texts and teachings.
I will choose the metaphor-laden texts of G.K. Chesterson.
You dedicate yourself to studying G.K. Chesterson's texts and teachings.
Who else but the great Martin Luther King II?
You dedicate yourself to studying Martin Luther King's texts and teachings.
I will choose the foundational teachings of John Wesley.
You dedicate yourself to studying John Wesley's texts and teachings.

Despite your great effort, you feel as if you have made no progress at all over the past few weeks. Earthly concerns have become more and more pressing, and you can no longer spend your time reading theological texts. You feel disappointed that you could not understand...
I am humbled by the ancients' great wisdom.
It's all nonsense anyway.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of Seraphim Rose's teachings. In particular, you feel as though you can finally square his controversial concept of spiritual "toll houses" with mainstream Christian thought, removing your final doubts as to the orthodoxy of his ideas.
Seraphim Rose was truly a wise man!
Studied Seraphim Rose
This character is an expert on the teachings of Seraphim Rose.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of Gregory Palamas's teachings. In particular, you feel as though you finally understand his distinction between the Divine Essence and the Divine Energies and why it does not conflict with the indivisibility of the Trinity.
A Saint indeed!
Studied Gregory Palamas
This character is an expert on the teachings of Gregory Palamas.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of Thomas Aquinas's teachings. In particular, you have a full understanding of his Five Proofs for the existence of God and his Five Statements regarding God's essence, deepening your faith and rendering you better able to fight apostasy.
I will never doubt again!
Studied Thomas Aquinas
This character is an expert on the teachings of Thomas Aquinas.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of G.K Chesterson's teachings. His use of subtle metaphor and wordplay was particularly hard to understand, particularly given that the language he used is no longer in common use. However, you have finally cleared the language barrier and are able to truly appreciate his command of Old American.
He was truly a master of language!
Studied G.K. Chesterson
This character is an expert on the teachings of G.K. Chesterson.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of Martin Luther King II's teachings. Many of his most important teachings were presented in a secular context, which made connecting them to Christian theology somewhat difficult. However, you now understand why and how every speech he ever gave was rooted in Christian thought.
His dream was a noble one!
Studied Martin Luther King II
This character is an expert on the teachings of Martin Luther King II.

After weeks of dedicated study, you finally understand the finer points of John Wesley's teachings. In particular, you have fully internalized his teachings against predestination, which defeat some of the most common arguments used by apostates against Christianity. You have never been more sure of your faith.
The love of God reigns supreme in my heart.
Studied John Wesley
This character is an expert on the teachings of John Wesley.
Become the Defender of the Faith

Western Christianity needs a capable and strong defender. A sufficiently powerful True Cross ruler may formally become the Defender of the Faith, guiding Christians away from apostasy and towards salvation.
You become the Defender of the Faith.
Defender of the Faith

The history of western Christianity has entered a new chapter. [Root.GetTitledName] has declared themselves Defender of the Faith, asserting that [Root.GetSheHe] has been divinely selected to lead the Christian faith back to prosperity. [Root.GetHerHisCap] claim has been eagerly accepted by all followers of the True Cross. The disunity of the West grows more serious by the day...
God bless [Root.GetTitledName]!
We will see whether [Root.GetHerHis] god protects [Root.GetHerHim]...
A blasphemous claim!
Praise God!
